content: Dr. Wanxiang Che is a professor of School of Computer Science and Technology, Harbin Institute of Technology. He is the vice director of Research Center for Social Computing and Information Retrieval. He is a young scholar of “Heilongjiang Scholar” and a visiting scholar of Stanford University. He is currently the vice director and secretary-general of the Computational Linguistics Professional Committee of the Chinese Information Society of China; Officer and Secretary of AACL Executive Board; a senior member of the China Computer Federation (CCF). He achieved for the AAAI 2013 Outstanding Paper Honorable Mention Award. His Language Technology Platform (LTP) has been shared by over 600 organizations, and authorized to Baidu, Tencent, and so on. He won the first place in CoNLL 2018 and 2019 shared tasks. In 2020, he won the Heilongjiang Youth Science and Technology Award; in 2015 and 2016, he won the Google Focused Research Award; in 2016, he won the first prize of the Heilongjiang Province Science and Technology Progress Award (2nd Place); in 2012, he won the second prize of the Heilongjiang Province Technology Invention Award (2nd Place); in 2010, he won the first prize of the “Qian Weichang” Chinese Information Processing Science and Technology Award of the Chinese Information Society of China (2nd Place), the Hanwang Youth Innovation Award (individual). In 2017, the MOOC course “Advanced Language Programming (Python)” taught by him won the National Excellent Online Open Course. «test»
summary: Dr. Wanxiang Che is a professor of School of Computer Science and Technology, Harbin Institute of Technology. He is the vice director of Research Center for Social Computing and Information Retrieval.
title: Wanxiang Che
